file_content.text: Killiks down, House Ulgo to go. Going to be a busy season.
Reports are saying the Killiks are already less aggressive.
Your report, Science Commander?
The strike team destroyed the Ulgo facility. Killik attacks have fallen by forty percent already.
It seems putting you in charge was the right decision after all.
Thank you, sir.
And this must be your strike team. Always a pleasure to see you.
It's been too long already.
Good to see you, too.
Now that the Killiks are dealt with--what next?
What happens now?
And this must be your strike team. You've done impressive work.
That's very kind of you.
Thank you.
I take it you're in charge of this operation.
You're running the show?
I am Duke Charle Organa, of the House Organa. My Republic associate is General Kashim. I'm afraid I can't talk long.
Your science commander doesn't know what she's doing.
This woman is incompetent.
I see. I hope there will be a report later.
Your science commander was planning to replicate Ulgo's experiments.
This woman is immoral.
Is that so? We should discuss this later, Commander.
Yes, sir.
Although Ulgo can no longer control the Killiks, they are still a threat. It'll be some time before we drive them back.
But then--then we strike at House Ulgo itself. Thanks to all of you.
I know we had our differences, but I'm willing to bury them. I've got battle plans to draw and a lot of stimcaf to drink.
Do whatever you want. Just keep me out of it.
You're a freak.
Yeah? Get out of here, then. Hope the Killiks don't eat your brain.
I owe you one--but right now, I've got reams of insect bioreadings to review and a lot of stimcaf to drink. So thanks.
I hope everything goes well. Be careful.
Good luck, Commander.
You, too. This war's no good for any of us--and it's a long way from over.
You owe me a reward.
The droid will see to it. I've got a couple surprises you might like--you'll need them out there.
Enjoy working with the bugs. I know I would.
Torture some Killiks for me.
Heh. There are still plenty of them out there--I'm sure you'll find company.
Find that cave where the Ulgos are hiding. We need to stop them and stop the Killiks.
We have our answer. Ulgo is torturing Killiks on our land, driving them against us. Take out the Ulgo pain factory, and you free up almost all our troops.
Suppose you're right--what's our next step?
How do we find it?
I attack a factory, I'll die.
Well, we don't have any other options, do we?
I've got my doubts.
There are no guarantees, but I don't think the Joiner's lying.
There's a cave system nearby. Ulgo troop levels are high, and we've spotted Killiks, too. Place is a death trap--no one gets near it.
It's got to be the pain factory. If you get inside, destroy the Ulgo forces and contact me. Let's stop that swarm.
You got one? Fantastic! Containment protocols, En-oh!
What have you done to us? We have strayed from the nest.
Good. If he can talk, he can tell us why the Killiks are attacking--and how House Ulgo is controlling them.
Listen to me. You're safe now. No one's going to hurt you.
Let me comfort him.
I'm a Jedi. I want to talk to you about the nest.
Can you understand me, Joiner?
We need to ask you a few questions. You understand?
Did you hear that, Joiner?
Is she right? Can you tell us why you've been attacking?
Talk to me, Joiner.
You said he'd be brainwashed.
What's happened to him?
Killik pheromones bond with chemicals in the brain. Long-term exposure has other physiological consequences, too.
This mission wasn't easy--a little thanks might be nice.
I almost got killed out there!
What? Sure, thank you. Now let's focus.
We remember when we lived among you. Before Joining the Kind. There was only isolation.
I'm going to run some scans. Hey--tell us why the aggression? Is Ulgo supplying you? Scaring you?
There is such pain now. The Song of the Universe is disrupted. The warriors are angry, and we swarm.
I don't understand. You say there's pain....
What do you mean?
He's your subject. How do you want to approach this?
Any ideas, Science Commander?
Cooperate or else.
We feel the agony. Your species is responsible. We must swarm!
There's a lot of neural activity. He is hurting--must be his connection to the hive mind. Not sure why.
Your people drag us to your pain factory beneath the mountains. You must be dissected and absorbed.
Where are Killiks being taken?
Talk about the "pain factory."
The tunnels. So close, we can sense them now....
Can't you give him something to calm him down?
We have to help him.
He's tranked already, but I might be able to synthesize something.
Enough threats. [Hurt him.]
The nest breeds warriors. We will rage....
Neural spike. Exactly how Ulgo does it.
En-oh, take him to a cell.
When we come, you will Join with us.
Research or strategy--either way, I need that Joiner for study.
Can this wait, En-oh? I've got seven bioscans left.
Patrols report a fifty percent increase in blaster malfunctions.
Okay, set up a meeting with the staff sergeant. And--blast it, tell me when guests are here!
Acknowledged.
Science Commander Keikana Herot, regional supervisor for the House Organa garrison. Glad you made it.
Science Commander. How's House Organa doing?
Good to meet you.
I take it things haven't been easy?
How can I help?
I don't think I'm familiar with that title, sir.
You're a "science commander"?
Look, I come from a research background, but I earned this command. Even if I don't like it.
Good to meet you, too. What's going on?
Thanks, I think.
How'd you know I was coming?
I didn't know I was expected.
With a base like this, I'd be glad for support, too.
This place is in sorry shape.
You've got no idea, believe me.
Saw the report on how you handled the Wolf Baron and House Thul. Hoped you could help us out here, too.
Heard reports about a new Jedi planetside. Could use some more Republic support here.
Heard reports about some special forces planetside. Could use some more Republic support here.
Reports say you've done some fancy things since coming planetside. Hoped you could help us out.
This area used to be a staging point against House Ulgo--usurper general calls himself king of Alderaan. But Ulgo outplayed us.
How were you outplayed?
Tell me what happened.
You said the Ulgo leader calls himself king?
What's House Ulgo's story?
"King Bouris Ulgo." He's held off Organa and Thul on his own. Military power and dirty tricks.
Of course you're outplayed. You need to learn to defend yourselves.
No surprise there.
The Republic was supposed to teach us. Guess that hasn't worked.
Alderaan has a native species called the Killiks. Insects, hive mind, semi-intelligent. House Ulgo turned them against us.
The bugs swarm, rip apart walkers, whole battalions.
Is Ulgo controlling the bugs somehow?
Why do the Killiks help Ulgo?
That's what I'd like to know.
When you say "insects," just how insectoid are we talking about?
Bugs... ugh.
Ever meet a Geonosian? Like that, but more leg.
Humans, aliens--I kill both.
Killing them isn't a solution. They'd just spawn another swarm.
I was drafted as science commander to find the Killiks' weakness. But I need a task force to get inside enemy territory.
If you can capture a living specimen, I can learn how Ulgo makes the nests attack--and stop all this at once.
If you've got a strategy, lay it out.
Let's hear the plan.
I'm up for a challenge.
Capture a bug? That's stupid.
What's our other option? Let ourselves get eaten alive?
Killiks can... absorb... prisoners into their hive mind. The victims are called "Joiners."
You'd need to assault Killik territory, subdue a Joiner under fire and bring him here for interrogation. This tranquilizer will keep him docile.
Assuming I can capture a Joiner--is that all?
Anything else?
I'm on the job.
Hey, we're losing this fight. If we don't solve the Killik problem soon, this place will be overrun.
You're our best hope, and there'll be no second chance.
You want to interrogate someone who thinks he's a bug... and I risk my life for this?
No way. [Refuse quest]
When you say it like that, it does sound a little less appetizing.
You'll have to wait. Droid can fetch you a cup of stimcaf.
